name: Work Song
description: Sung by laborers and prisoners while working in factories and fields.

children.name: Aboio
children.description: Cattle-herding songs originating in rural Northeastern Brazil.

children.name: Field Hollers
children.description: Created by African-American slaves working on cotton plantations, featuring expressive vocals to no strict rhythm.

children.name: Haozi
children.description: Chinese Work Song that originated from collective manual labor and usually follows a call-and-response structure, aiming to coordinate work.

children.name: Sea Shanty
children.description: Songs originally sung by sailors to coordinate work on ships.

children.name: Shan'ge
children.description: Folk songs found in upland regions of China, typically sung while working.

children.name: Òrain luaidh
children.description: Rhythmic call-and-response style song form that traditionally accompanied the production of tweed cloth through beating the material by hand to soften it after it came off the loom.
